While supported by the system, we don’t encourage using outside software to draft up text. This is because when copying content from an external source, it can sometimes bring code which could be malicious and cause formatting issues. Whenever possible, you are encouraged to draft posts directly in Wordpress.

You finish all of the edits you’ve made to your story, you go to publish or save as a draft. But then, WordPress freezes up. You’re stuck. When the page refreshes, your entire article is *gone.*

When you visit a website, the website sends a cookie to your computer. Your computer stores it in a file located inside your web browser. The purpose of the computer cookie is to help the website keep track of your visits and activity. 
 Once you clear *cookies* and *cache*, accessing cms tools should be quicker.
